      • getServiceRequest

        public ServiceRequest getServiceRequest(ServiceToken serviceToken)
        Create a service request for the given ServiceToken. This method creates the request, populating existing headers and cookies for the same service. The request is populated with all the defaults for the service being invoked and requires only the request body to be set. Headers and cookies may be manipulated as needed by the application before submitting the ServiceRequest via invokeService.
        Specified by:
        getServiceRequest in interface IService
        Parameters:
        serviceToken - ServiceToken to be used for the creation of the request.
        Returns:
        ServiceRequest with pre-populated headers, cookies and defaults for the service.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • getServiceToken

        public ServiceToken getServiceToken(java.lang.String serviceName,
                                    java.lang.String endpointName,
                                    java.lang.String functionName,
                                    IServiceMethod method)
        Obtains a ServiceToken for the given parameters to be used for the creation of requests.
        Specified by:
        getServiceToken in interface IService
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Service name.
        endpointName - Endpoint name.
        functionName - Function name.
        method - Method type.
        Returns:
        ServiceToken to create a service request or null if the given parameter combination is not configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • getServicesRegistered

        public ServiceToken[] getServicesRegistered()
        Returns all the possible service tokens configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Specified by:
        getServicesRegistered in interface IService
        Returns:
        Array of service tokens configured.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • invokeService

        public void invokeService(ServiceRequest serviceRequest,
                          IServiceResultCallback callback)
        Executes the given ServiceRequest and provides responses to the given callback handler.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        callback - IServiceResultCallback to handle the ServiceResponse.

      • isServiceRegistered

        public boolean isServiceRegistered(java.lang.String serviceName,
                                   java.lang.String endpointName,
                                   java.lang.String functionName,
                                   IServiceMethod method)
        Checks whether a specific service, endpoint, function and method type is configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Specified by:
        isServiceRegistered in interface IService
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Service name.
        endpointName - Endpoint name.
        functionName - Function name.
        method - Method type.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the service is configured, false otherwise.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • invoke

        public APIResponse invoke(APIRequest request)
        Invokes the given method specified in the API request object.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface APIBridge
        Overrides:
        invoke in class BaseCommunicationBridge
        Parameters:
        request - APIRequest object containing method name and parameters.
        Returns:
        APIResponse with status code, message and JSON response or a JSON null string for void functions. Status code 200 is OK, all others are HTTP standard error conditions.
